case_title: Messrs AL BASHIR COLD STORAGE vs COMMISSIONER (APPEALS) PRA, LAHORE

accussed_details.name: Messrs AL BASHIR COLD STORAGE
allegation: Non-registration under Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of failing to register under the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012 and not filing tax returns, resulting in penalties.
investigation_summary: The appellant was issued a show-cause notice on 09-03-2018 for non-registration and non-filing of returns. The Enforcement Officer imposed penalties totaling Rs. 130,000. The Commissioner (Appeals) reduced the penalty to Rs. 40,000 for late filing of returns, deleting the Rs. 50,000 penalty for non-registration due to lack of mens rea.
judgment_summary: The Appellate Tribunal set aside the orders of the Enforcement Officer and the Commissioner (Appeals), finding no mens rea on the appellant's part for non-registration. The appeal was allowed, and penalties were annulled.
legal_arguments: Mens rea is an essential element for imposing penalties in statutory offences.
The appellant registered before receiving the show-cause notice, negating willful default.
Principles of natural justice and fairness were not adhered to in the adjudication process.
statutes: Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012
Punjab Sales Tax on Services (Adjudication and Appeals) Rules, 2015
Punjab Sales Tax on Services (Registration and De-registration) Rules, 2012
key_issues: Whether the appellant's failure to register and file returns constituted willful default.
Whether penalties imposed were justified in the absence of mens rea.

maxims.Mens Rea: An essential element in statutory offences unless explicitly excluded by statute.

legal_terms.Mens Rea: The intention or knowledge of wrongdoing.
legal_terms.Show-Cause Notice: A notice requiring a party to explain or justify their actions.

words_and_phrases.Mens Rea: Mental state of intent to commit a crime.
words_and_phrases.Natural Justice: Principles of fairness in legal proceedings.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved penalties imposed on Messrs AL BASHIR COLD STORAGE for non-registration and non-filing of tax returns under the Punjab Sales Tax on Services Act, 2012. The Tribunal found no mens rea on the appellant's part, as they registered before receiving the show-cause notice. The appeal was allowed, and penalties were annulled.
